page.title: 07HOUSING
page.content: Aston has 89 dwellings consisting of:- 37 brick houses, 15 stone hdwellings (10=2x5 semis); 36 new Bradstone (stone substitute); 1 timber houses; 24 of the brick houses comprise the council estate, Plowden Close, though many tenants now own these houses. The manor is of stone, the Old Rectory of red brick. 31 dwellings are bungalows. Bradstopne is a reconstituted stone, cheaper than the Hornton stone of which this village was built. It was used for an estate of speculative houses for business people and retired folk, the latter buying the bungalows.
